title: Draw Isocube Versions of Tibbles
text: basic example shows solve common problem:

what: Calculate isocubes coordinates from a height matrix — coords_heightmap
title: Calculate isocubes coordinates from a height matrix — coords_heightmap
Calculate isocubes coordinates from a height matrix — coords_heightmap
code: coords_heightmap(   mat,   col = NULL,   scale = 1,   flipx = FALSE,   flipy = TRUE,   ground = "xz",   solid = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Calculate isocubes coordinates from a height matrix — coords_heightmap
text: mat integer matrix. matrix interpreted cubes flat page, value matrix interpreted height page. col matrix colours dimensions mat argument. Default: NULL.   col NULL,  col column included final returned coordinates. scale scale factor values matrix. Default = 1 flipx, flipy matrix flipped horizontal/vertical directions (respectively)? Default: flipx = FALSE, flipy = TRUE. Note: flipy defaults TRUE matrices indexed top-, isometric coordinate space increasing bottom .   Flipping matrix vertically usually  want. ground Orientation ground plane. Default: 'xz'.  Possible values 'xz', 'xy' solid heightmap made 'solid' .e. without holes? default: TRUE.  can expensive operation terms  memory CPU, OK simple examples. Set FALSE things take long.  operation works  extruding cubes top height map floor  ensure gaps appear slope great. verbose verbose? default: FALSE

title: Draw a column — draw_column
code: draw_column(   xpos,   ncubes = 10,   fill = "gray80",   darkenby = 0.05,   z = 0,   delete_x = NULL,   delete_y = NULL,   light = "left-top",   ysize = 1/ncubes )

title: Draw a column — draw_column
text: xpos x ncubes x fill x darkenby x z x delete_x x delete_y x light x ysize x

title: Draw a row — draw_row
code: draw_row(   ypos,   ncubes = 10,   fill = "gray80",   darkenby = 0.05,   z = 0,   delete = NULL,   light = "left-top",   ysize = 1/ncubes )

title: Draw a row — draw_row
text: ypos x ncubes x fill x darkenby x z x delete x light x ysize x

title: Draw on z — draw_z
text: zpos x ncubes x fill x darkenby x

what: Create a grob of isocubes — isocubesGrob
title: Create a grob of isocubes — isocubesGrob
Create a grob of isocubes — isocubesGrob
code: isocubesGrob(   coords,   fill = "grey90",   fill2 = NULL,   fill3 = NULL,   light = "top-left",   ysize = 1/20,   xo = 0.5,   yo = ysize,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Create a grob of isocubes — isocubesGrob
text: coords data.frame x,y,z coordinates cubes (integer coordinates) fill fill colour main face cube specified light  argument.  default, colour top face cube,  default light = 'top-left'. fill2, fill3 fill colours secondary tertiary faces cube - specified light argument.   set NULL (default) cube faces darkened versions  main fill color. light direction light.  two-word argument nominating  main light direction secondary light direction. default value 'top-left' indicates light brightest top,  left side cube - right side cube darkest. argument used fill2 fill3 unspecified. Possible values : top-left, top-right, left-top, left-right, right-top, right-left. ysize size cube fraction window height. Default: 0.05,  means , , 20 cubes stack top bottom  visible. xo, yo origin isometric coordinate system 'snpc' coordinates. values given vanilla floating point values. default origin middle bottom graphics device  .e. (xo, yo) = (0.5, 0) verbose verbose? Default FALSE. ... values passed gpar() set graphical parameters e.g. lwd col linewidth colour outline stroke cube face.
